# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can define the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Here's an example of how to use it:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In id nunc eget odio tincidunt sollicitudin."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit. 
In id nunc eget 
odio tincidunt 
sollicitudin.
```
